text:
I’m undiagnosed. However, I’ve had several things happen to me since 8th grade that have been absolutely horrible. I have a therapist and I talked to her last week about what’s currently going on (breakup after a week), and she thinks it’s depression as well. 
I really wish I could just have one year where I wasn’t crying about dysphoria, breakup or bad grades. 
All I want is for it to get better.
Then... fix your grades, and stop dating stupid people. There's 2 of 3 problems solved right there.
She’s not stupid.
Feels like my life is a long drawn out story of me getting really good at something... and then just giving up on it for no apparent reason.

I've had depression my entire life. I've just turned 33, and things have never improved. I really don't know what to do anymore, what else to try, who to turn to.
I've had 20+ therapists, tried 10+ different kinds of medication, and I've even done TMS and ketamine. I exercise, eat healthy, don't drink, don't watch porn, don't play video games, don't use social media, or watch TV. I've tried moving states, cities, and jobs. I've never had any friends, never had a gf. Even when I try, I never meet anyone. Nothing helps even a little.
I'm beginning to think that my life will always be this way, since it has always been this way. I'm beginning to really believe suicide is my only remaining option to free me from this pain. The national hotline is completely garbage. I've even put myself in the hospital once before, because I thought surely I'd receive help. No, I was treated like a prisoner, and received no help.
I really just don't know where to turn or what else to do.

I've been looking for a new job for months. And I only seem
 able to attract similar miserable shit jobs with insane work hour expectations and zero work life balance. I'll take a huge paycut willingly, I just want my life back. :( Every episode of depression that I have had has been in part because of work. I know everyone has to work to live, but how can people tolerate it? I just burn out into nothing so easily.

Wow I just came to this sub and the very first thing I read is your post and it is my exact same problem. Wishing you the best in your search.. 
I’m ready to deliver pizza. I can’t handle stressful work anymore, it is ruining my life.

Thanks for sharing. I hope you find something that allows you to get your life back. Most employers don't want to touch me with a 10 ft pole because I keep job hopping. I might just take any part time gig while I go back to school.
nobody responded to my post asking for help and I just took a bunch of pills even though I know damn well it won’t be enough to kill me
I feel the same way I hope you live though
I did in fact live, turns out suicide by OD is so difficult because you’re very likely to vomit it all up anyway

A few weeks ago I broke up with my ex, I genuinely loved her with all my heart but every day she would say things that would make me think she hated the relationship so i broke up because I knew it is what she wanted and I knew I couldn't give her the love she needs.
But this last few days, my head has been completely gone I feel so broken. I built this wall around me because every few weeks she'd block me and in the end i let her go.
just trying to make it through Christmas….ugh. I hate trying to hold it together in front of family.

I’m listening to NY music, all the classics, you name it, sprinkled in with some more recently released tracks, but I’m not feeling anything in particular, aside from the fact that familiar songs are familiar because the path(ways) for them in my brain are well trodden. 
Since leaving, I’ve not missed my hometown once, not even now. Isn’t this type of music supposed to help you reconstruct the memory associating with certain places? It feels kinda alienating because I don’t find the lyrics resonating at all, the majority of them. A weird spot to be in, emotionally. The goal is, perhaps, not to try to pinpoint and label exactly what feelings I’m going through at the moment. Goals? Just stop being ridiculous and being as humanely productive as possible. Being vaguely intimate with the way things are enough. 
Let it be, before you get caught up in the unceasing rhythm of life again.

24 here.
I guess the hardest thing about this is wanting to get better means wanting to live, and I know it sounds pathetic but I don't. I never have. Now I've graduated, with a degree that's not useless but practically robbed me of my one release, trying to figure shit out but sabotaging myself at every turn. Didn't help that I turned to addiction (alcohol, weed) the past years because my bi-polar was already fucking insane (not that those helped, it was just a placebo) and the unresolved trauma I have both from growing up and from life after (I was in a drive-by on the other side of a window not too long ago, friend of a friend I used to smoke with was gunned down (which even though I only know him from smoking on occasion for some reason fucks me up, feels like I shouldn't feel this way because I didn't know him that well)). 
I don't know how it feels to want to live. I lied about it to get out of the psych ward years ago, and have learned better than to talk about it for fear of being forced to go back. Hence the escapism, that like you manifested in being raised by TV™ because of zero emotional support (I tried to kill myself in middle school, I tried asking for help and was greeted with an hour long yell session while being told to suck it up; naturally there's been attempts since, I guess I'm lucky I'm still here? I wish I could just transfer my years to someone who actually wanted to, very few people actually know and I was essentially in a coma after od'ing on Xanax and whiskey for a whole weekend, woke up to nothing, shit the only way they'd know if it was successful is after my body would start to rot and the smells going everywhere causing someone in the building to notice).
So here I am. Technically recovering from carpal tunnel surgery that I let progress and fuck me up for too long. I know that I can't kill myself, and I guess that's fine, but it means I need to find some attachment and I for the love it can't. Guess I'll figure it out eventually, feels like it's already too late.
I really don't want to be here. I really just don't want to be here.

Also 24. Same experience minus the addiction/drugs. Also graduated with a good degree in IT with a fairly good road-map of how to make a great living within 5 years... does not help with anything. At all. I feel like I didn't do it for me but because everyone said I should. No emotional support. My 5th grade teacher expressed far more concern and care after learning I was suicidal than my parents. I also got scolded for that, and then scolded again when my 6th grade counselor called my parents up about me mentioning them arguing all of the time.
I really guess you really just find a way to keep going. I can't say I have that much will to live in a way that would be feasible. After all I went through to graduate and try to start my career, I would throw it all away to feel like someone cared about me beyond basic needs and to figure out what I genuinely want which is not to work for 40 years no matter how much I might make.

Without knowing exactly what they're saying, it's hard to assess risk or make specific suggestions.  
I'd suggest sending full details of what they've been saying to our modmail at /r/SuicideWatch.  (The "Contact the Moderators" function is a sidebar link on desktop and a subreddit menu option on mobile.)
Alternatively, you can call your local crisis line or the national TalkSuicide line yourself and get expert guidance in real time.  1.833.456.4566

spending the holidays p much alone and wanted to die today. like everyone’s out having friendsmas or whatever and i don’t have any of that. maybe i’m just stupid and crazy and should kill myself because nobody likes me anyway
Things are going better but they aren’t, I have a habit of making plans and then canceling them last minute cause “I’m sick” and I did that again today.

Feeling a bit desperate....I'm a complete failure as a man - I have no girlfriend, no marriage prospects, and no children at age 43. The one thing that society expects me to be, the only measurement I know to determine if I have any value as a member of of species and I've failed utterly and totally on this basis.
People say value comes from within. This seems particularly cruel as there's no proof that this is true. I disagree with the concept with every fiber of my being...you you have value if people in society values you. For me, external validation and social markers are the only thing I have to know that I should continue living.
It's christmastime and I feel so valueless, unloved and worthless and I am trying to catalog the reasons to keep going.
